narrative=Iain Hunt, a 9-year-old boy, was last reported seen by his brother near their home at 36 Parkgate, Rosyth. Known to have been a mental health facility patient, Iain had a history of wandering and disappearing for short periods. During that time, he was particularly fond of visiting certain familiar places, including Dunnikier Park, Kirkcaldy, and the vicinity near 137 Admiralty Road, Rosyth. His family became concerned when he didn't return home and reached out to Sandra, a family friend, who often accompanied Iain on walks. After several days of searching, a vigilant member of the public identified him at 5 Seamill Gardens, Burntisland, appearing unharmed but confused, and promptly notified the authorities.

narrative=Iain Hunt, a young boy from Bath, went missing from his home at 36 Parkgate, Rosyth. Iain was known to be a patient at a mental health facility due to his unique needs, which required constant monitoring. On the day of his disappearance, Iain was supposed to meet his brother at the local youth center. However, he never arrived, causing concern for his family and friend. His father reported him missing after they realized Iain hadn’t been seen for some time. A multi-day search ensued, concentrating around local recreational zones and places familiar to Iain. Eventually, the police located Iain at 35 Fowler Street, Cellardyke, safe but disoriented. He was promptly reunited with his family, who were relieved to find him uninjured.
